drive_clone_failure_drive_cloning_window.root_cause: The drive cloning failure appears to stem from insufficient permissions (User Privileges: 0) and possibly locked/in-use drive status. Windows requires elevated privileges for direct disk access, and the target path structure suggests potential path formatting issues.

solutions.name: Elevated Administrator Access with DiskPart
steps: Use DiskPart to ensure drive isn't in use
requirements: Sufficient free space on target drive
Target drive not in active use
solutions.risks: Data loss if wrong disk selected
solutions.expected_outcome: Complete disk image creation with full system access

solutions.name: Third-Party Imaging Software Solution
steps: Download and install Macrium Reflect Free
solutions.expected_outcome: Successful drive image creation with verification

solutions.name: DD for Windows Implementation
steps: Execute dd command with proper parameters

preventive_measures: Always run disk operations with administrative privileges
Verify target drive path exists and has correct permissions
Ensure sufficient free space before starting operation
Disconnect or offline source drive from other processes
Use UNC paths to avoid path formatting issues
alternative_approaches: Boot from Linux live USB and use ddrescue
Use Windows Volume Shadow Copy Service (VSS) for online backup
File-level backup instead of raw disk clone
Use Windows built-in backup and restore functionality
